QuestionBlock.Description: Oral Questions to the Secretary of State for Culture, Media and Sport

Question.Text: What steps her Department is taking to support local journalism.
Question.AnsweringBody: Department for Culture, Media and Sport

Question.Text: What steps her Department is taking to support the horse racing industry.
Question.AnsweringBody: Department for Culture, Media and Sport
Question.DeclaredInterest: Relevant interests are found in the Member's Register

Question.Text: What assessment she has made of the impact of the Youth Investment Fund on opportunities for young people.
Question.AnsweringBody: Department for Culture, Media and Sport

Question.Text: What steps she is taking to support the participation of women and girls in sport.
Question.AnsweringBody: Department for Culture, Media and Sport

Question.Text: What steps her Department is taking to protect and repurpose heritage buildings.
Question.AnsweringBody: Department for Culture, Media and Sport

Question.Text: What assessment she has made of the impact of the Swimming Pool Support Fund on local pools and leisure facilities.
Question.AnsweringBody: Department for Culture, Media and Sport

Question.Text: What steps she is taking to support the participation of women and girls in sport.
Question.AnsweringBody: Department for Culture, Media and Sport

Question.Text: If her Department will take steps to support snooker clubs.
Question.AnsweringBody: Department for Culture, Media and Sport

Question.Text: What recent progress her Department has made on its review of the Gambling Act 2005.
Question.AnsweringBody: Department for Culture, Media and Sport

Question.Text: What recent assessment she has made of the impact of the Multi-Sport Grassroots Facilities Programme on access to sport for young people.
Question.AnsweringBody: Department for Culture, Media and Sport

Question.Text: If she will have discussions with the Secretary of State for Levelling Up, Housing and Communities on the different level of usage of public parks for recreational sports by girls and boys.
Question.AnsweringBody: Department for Culture, Media and Sport

Question.Text: Whether she has had recent discussions with the Welsh Government and the independent television production sector on the appointment of a new Chair for S4C.
Question.AnsweringBody: Department for Culture, Media and Sport

Question.Text: What assessment she has made of the impact of the Swimming Pool Support Fund on local pools and leisure facilities.
Question.AnsweringBody: Department for Culture, Media and Sport

Question.Text: What recent assessment she has made of the impact of the UK's departure from the EU on the music industry.
Question.AnsweringBody: Department for Culture, Media and Sport

Question.Text: What recent discussions she has had with Ofcom on enforcement of the Broadcasting Code.
Question.AnsweringBody: Department for Culture, Media and Sport

Question.Text: If she will make an assessment of the effectiveness of Government support for local media.
Question.AnsweringBody: Department for Culture, Media and Sport

QuestionBlock.Description: Topical Questions to the Secretary of State for Culture, Media and Sport

Question.Text: If she will make a statement on her departmental responsibilities.
Question.AnsweringBody: Department for Culture, Media and Sport

Question.Text: If she will make a statement on her departmental responsibilities.
Question.AnsweringBody: Department for Culture, Media and Sport

Question.Text: If she will make a statement on her departmental responsibilities.
Question.AnsweringBody: Department for Culture, Media and Sport

Question.Text: If she will make a statement on her departmental responsibilities.
Question.AnsweringBody: Department for Culture, Media and Sport

Question.Text: If she will make a statement on her departmental responsibilities.
Question.AnsweringBody: Department for Culture, Media and Sport

Question.Text: If she will make a statement on her departmental responsibilities.
Question.AnsweringBody: Department for Culture, Media and Sport

Question.Text: If she will make a statement on her departmental responsibilities.
Question.AnsweringBody: Department for Culture, Media and Sport

QuestionBlock.Description: Oral Questions to the Chairman of the Public Accounts Commission and the hon. Member for Broxbourne, representing the House of Commons Commission and the hon. Member for Lancaster and Fleetwood, representing the Speaker's Committee on the Electoral Commission and the Member for South West Bedfordshire, representing the Church Commissioners

Question.Text: To ask the Chairman of the Public Accounts Commission, if he will make an assessment of the adequacy of National Audit Office resources to scrutinise the cost of AI in government.
Question.AnsweringBody: Public Accounts Commission

Question.Text: To ask the Chairman of the Public Accounts Commission, if he will make an assessment of the adequacy of National Audit Office resources to undertake analysis on the efficiency and effectiveness of NHS procurement.
Question.AnsweringBody: Public Accounts Commission

Question.Text: To ask the hon. Member for South West Bedfordshire, representing the Church Commissioners, whether the Church of England is taking steps to provide affordable and sustainable housing on its land.
Question.AnsweringBody: Church Commissioners

Question.Text: To ask the hon. Member for South West Bedfordshire, representing the Church Commissioners, what recent assessment the Church of England has made of the adequacy of the support offered by dioceses to a parish in an interregnum.
Question.AnsweringBody: Church Commissioners

Question.Text: To ask the hon. Member for South West Bedfordshire, representing the Church Commissioners, what recent assessment the Church of England has made of the impact of church schools on the level of educational attainment in (a) Cleethorpes constituency and (b) England.
Question.AnsweringBody: Church Commissioners

Question.Text: To ask the hon. Member for South West Bedfordshire, representing the Church Commissioners, what steps the Church of England is taking to provide funding to parish churches.
Question.AnsweringBody: Church Commissioners

Question.Text: To ask the hon. Member for Luton South, representing the Speaker's Committee on the Electoral Commission, if she will hold discussions with the Electoral Commission on the rules on the registration of descriptions of political parties.
Question.AnsweringBody: Speaker's Committee on the Electoral Commission
Question.DeclaredInterest: I am Leader of the Workers Party of Britain, a party affected by these seeming double standards.

Question.Text: To ask the hon. Member for Broxbourne, representing the House of Commons Commission, what recent progress the Commission has made on using digital tools to support the work of hon. Members.
Question.AnsweringBody: House of Commons Commission

Question.Text: To ask the hon. Member for South West Bedfordshire, representing the Church Commissioners, what steps the Church of England is taking to increase the number of Academy schools it sponsors.
Question.AnsweringBody: Church Commissioners

Question.Text: To ask the hon. Member for South West Bedfordshire, representing the Church Commissioners, what steps the Church of England is taking to provide support for people in Gaza.
Question.AnsweringBody: Church Commissioners

Question.Text: To ask the hon. Member for Luton South, representing the Speaker's Committee on the Electoral Commission, whether the Committee has had recent discussions with the Electoral Commission on the potential impact of disinformation on the integrity of elections.
Question.AnsweringBody: Speaker's Committee on the Electoral Commission
